Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Bad Bed”
Reviews.Author: biandi
Reviews.Content: Ok so the location of this hotel is great, its a decent walk or cab ride to most things and in a safe location. Our room had like 4 huge closets on the size of a small bedroom which was interesting. The kitcenette was useful to store our drinks and to set up our late night run to pat and genos for a taste off. Having a pub on the first floor was great for drinks at night and breakfast the next morning. The balcony was huge and provided a great view of the city just dont smoke out there or you will be paying a huge sign is what the sign says. My only complaint was it felt like we were sleeping on wooden boxes covered in sheets.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: bretkero
Reviews.Content: a great suite hotel but they didn't listen to my request for a high balcony king suite but instead gave me a 2 bed 2 bath suite with no view suite was great but as first trip to Philly would have liked a view would stay again but would request balcony price good for Philly

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, clean & quaint”
Reviews.Author: Flowerdiva71
Reviews.Content: What a treat to have such a large room with kitchen! AND walk in closet. A wonderful place conveniently located. You be hard pressed to find this kind of space for such a great price. Went through booking.com and got a great rate, even though it was Flower Show week. Room and hall remind me of the Palmer House Hilton in Chicago, which I love.

Reviews.Title: “Location- that's it”
Reviews.Author: teachersms
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for conference- can't beat location walling distance to SLA, fresh market, few restaurants, and Many museums!! Cons- dated, worn and not super clean. Had a 'smokey' & dirty catpet feeling.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location and price”
Reviews.Author: drmgeorge
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Suites are really well located for Philadelphia visitors. The price is right. But as my mother told me, you get what you pay for. The room I was perfectly adequate. Bed was average. While the bathroom had been updated, the shower was really bad (tiny and low pressure). My colleague had a totally renovated room which was much nicer. Front desk folks are really nice. So, I'd probably stay here again because of the location and price, but I would insist on a totally renovated room. Don't forget your toothbrush either. They don't have them to give to you!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: HullUKAnon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close by to the subway which you may not need to use as everything is well within walking distance. The rooms are clean and spacious although some may consider them a little worn but was fine for our purposes. The staff were also very helpful and professional. If you plan on using the cooking facilities on a regular basis the best place to get fresh ingredients is the Reading Market which is about a ten minute walk but is well worth it - also home of great takeaway places and fantastic cake/Amish puddings suppliers. There isn't a major supermarket nearby but there is a small mini mart nearby. Felt safe anywhere we went and the locals were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible night's sleep - Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkG_Oakton
Reviews.Content: If you want a good night sleep, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. Family and I were supposed to stay at Windsor for two nights, but checked out after one after having one of the worst nights sleeps we ever had. Beds/pillows were the most uncomfortable of any hotel we ever stayed at. These were horrible. Note to Windsor: Don't buy the cheapest beds/pillows you can find. Additional problems included: * headboard on one of the beds broke off and fell to the floor * couch had rips in it * walls paper-thin - could easily hear people in room next door (and I don't think they were overly loud) * room was way too hot and there was no way to adjust it down Given the price of the room we were definitely not expecting the Ritz...but we were expecting a lot more than we got from Windsor. Avoid this hotel and spend the few dollars more to stay at Embassy Suites next door. That's where we moved after our horrible night here.

Reviews.Title: “Central location & spacious room at good price”
Reviews.Author: Sonianna
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Windsor Suites in Philadelphia. We were there for marathon week-end (November 20 to 23, 2011) and the hotel was full. The room was spacious and the beds very comfortable. We were really pleased with the amenities (full kitchenette and pots&pans). The only negative part of the room was the hot water which we thought was intermittent. A technician came in our room twice to attend to this issue. But we later learned that if we let the water run for about 5 mins hot water starts to come out. This is a bit annoying and big waste of water at the same time. We would definitely go back there despite this little problem since there was hot water it just took some time to get it...

Reviews.Title: “Construction, out-dated space, and mice!”
Reviews.Author: Themad11
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying here for business, and this hotel is where they have housed us. At this moment, the sounds of drills and hammering are surrounding me from every angle. There's major construction happening a few floors above me but apparently the sound is echoed throughout the building. It is SOOOOO loud that it has given me a serious headache. What's really upsetting is that the most they have done for us is give us some cheap earplugs! Come on Windsor....this is not a way to run a business. The rooms need serious updating...the kitchen supplies are old and incomplete....it took me over an hour and a half to bake cookies! And they still weren't cooked! And on top of it all....i've seen a mouse twice run across my floor! If I hadn't been given this place to stay through my employer, I would definitely be choosing a different place to stay. Be warned. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Windsor Suites”
Reviews.Author: lsm_dk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Suites for 3 days in October and really enjoyed our stay. The room was large and everything was working (including the hot water as some people have had problems with according to other posts) even though the room was a bit dated. From the location of the hotel we were able to walk to all the places we wanted to visit. If we come back to Philadelphia we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dolphan13
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times now, the location is great for sightseers as there is a lot to see within walking distance. The hotel is clean, staff is very nice (especially the front desk) and the rooms are nice. You get free wireless and the parking is fair and convenient. The only thing I would complain about is the elevators can sometimes take a lot of time and are somewhat small so they are full a lot, especially during checkout time. The pool is nothing special but hey, it's a pool. Good value here for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: twoguysatMysteryCt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a lovely hotel. The service staff were excellent, the hotel was clean, the rooms were fresh. Only downer was the Comcast Center blocked the sun on the pool, which made it chilly. Overall, amazing time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - room OK.”
Reviews.Author: The_Pou
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Windsor Suites Hotel for two nights, good overall experience. The room was correct but old, need to be upgrade for the water system. The location is just great! Less than 5 minutes walk from the Rocky Statue and Metro Transit.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional reception / management”
Reviews.Author: ArneMoor
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Windsor Suites as family of three. When we checked in the lady at the reception seemed to be unhappy that she had to serve customers, beside the room number she said nearly nothing and spent quit a lot of her time on the phone during chekin. When we went to the room we got nearly depressed as it was more like a box then an apartment. Asking at the reception for a room matching the hotel description we were threaten like dump, stating that all rooms are equivalent. The fire rescue plan told something different, and today we had the chance to get a look of another (single) guests room which was about 50% bigger. At least we now understand the different ratings here. Having a room towards the street is quit spacy, having a room to the backside is horrible. With the "no service" reception this is a "no recommendation"!

Reviews.Title: “Probably will not be back”
Reviews.Author: zaika24
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Philly. Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Overall, the location of the hotel is pretty good - can walk pretty much anywhere (at least the places that were of interest to us were all walking distance, except for the outlet mall, but we had a car). Service was ok, nothing special. Rooms were clean at the end of the day. Now about not so good things. Our bed was not that comfortable. Mattress was so soft and the softest part was right in the middle, which left us with stiff backs in the morning. We never managed to get hot water from the shower. It was extremely annoying that we had to swipe our key card to get into elevator - most of the time the card didn't work (then it stopped working altogether, at least the other one worked for the room). To be honest, we expected a bit more from this hotel, judging by the reviews (although our expectations were not that high, given the hotel ranking and pricing). All in all, we won't be back. Money wise it's not that bad but a good night sleep is also worth something!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: manali1
Reviews.Content: Great location, you can walk everywhere and save on cab fares. The hotel room is huge, just like an apartment with fully equipped kitchen. There are many lovely restaurants that are closeby too. I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: Patsy and Zarena were very helpful and accommodating with the requests my wife and I made. The general manager was passing through the lobby as I was checking in and stopped to say he hopes we have a nice stay. We spent the last two nights in a much more expensive hotel in one of the tall buildings. The room was comfortable and the staff was nice there, but we had no coffee, microwave, or free internet. The view was of an alley. At Windsor suites we are on a beautiful boulevard with great views of the Art Museum (with the "Rocky Movie" steps) on one end and the ornate city hall on the other end. We have coffee, microwave, free internet, and much more. I think you get more bang for your buck at Windsor Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Suites, Philadelphia, are a excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: practans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights while in Philadelphia for medical appointments. From arrival to departure the staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. I think that the Windsor is a converted apartment house (the upper floors are apartments), so the suites are huge. In addition to a bedroom about the size of a typical hotel room, there was a large living room/dining room combination and a very adequate kitchenette. The views are excellent. Breakfast was not included in the very reasonable room rate (for downtown Philadelphia), but a discounted breakfast is available at one of the on-site restaurants. In addition to the Irish pub and the Asian restaurants on-site, restaurants abound in the vicinity. The location of the hotel in center city Philadelphia on the Benjamin Franklin Parkway two blocks from City Hall is excellent. Restaurants, tourist attractions, entertainment, the convention center, transportation are all within walking distance or a short cab or bus ride. The hotel is an older property so if you are super-critical you might find a few things to criticize (for example the bathrooms are not the most modern) but the property is in good condition and well maintained. Parking is available next door and the high center city rates are discounted about 15% for guests. In addition in and out privileges are available at no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: redwings63
Reviews.Content: Room was large, although strangely shaped. We had a double without a balcony, with kitchenette and large storage area. Laundry area was conveniently located, which we took advantage of. Decided one day to go to the pool on the roof, was small but seemed to be kept up nicely. Make sure you get your luggage out of your car before you park, it was completely valet, I have no idea how hard it would have been to get something out afterward. We walked to the metro, restaurants were nearby. Took metro everywhere we could.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel in dire need of renovations.”
Reviews.Author: wendy5o4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently and... PROS: location good in popular area where you can walk to Chinatown, Visitor`s Area, Independence Hall, etc., rooms are large and can fit up to 4 people. CONS: overall condition of the room is old in appearance and needs to be updated with modern decor, kitchen looked worn out as well and some of the cabinets had mold growing inside, beds are NOT comfortable, breakfast items served at restaurant not good and below average (did not see anyone else eat there at that time), parking is about 30 per night and almost all hotels in that downtown area do charge to park a vehicle, breakfast not included in rates OVERALL: Can not recommend this hotel due to conditions of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: EliToby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Philadelphia for the weekend for our anniversary. We stayed at the Windsor Suites with the Sleepover package. The hotel was great. We were upgraded to a suite on the 16th floor with a great view (we didn't even tell them that it was our anniversary). The staff were very helpful and the location was great. We were within walking distance of the art museum as well as plenty of restaurants. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: steacher11
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel at the last minute due to renovation of our original hotel, and we were very pleased with the change. The location was excellent, close to museums, parks, and city hall. The room was enormous with a full kitchen, large bathroom and walk-in closet. The staff was very friendly and courteous. At one point we asked for extra linens and they arrived at our door within minutes. Our only complaint was the elevators...very small and slow- but not a big deal. Overall, we were extremely pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could do with a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Wooler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 3 boys (15,13,11) in 2 rooms. Parking is by valet only and was around $29 a day. Check in was good and receptionist helpful. Rooms were clean though dated and showing signs of age, beds were comfy. I slept ok though there was a lot of noise from the street from early on in the morning, lots of roadworks etc. Location is good for sightseeing, 15 - 20 min walk to independence hall etc. Pool on the roof is ok but very cold, good view from up there. Free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Massive rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AlldoJabalina
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms with kitchen, dining table, loads of storage - after stayIng in tiny manhattan rooms this place was MASSIVE!! the decor could do with an overhaul (was a bit 'Fresh Prince of Bel Air'), but it was nice and clean. The pool on the roof was basic but fine, shame the sun wasn't out!! Had some great food in Philly (tapas in Bar Ferdinand in thd Northern Liberties, Mexican in El Vez), will be back hopefully!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfamincali
Reviews.Content: This hotel was old and just did not seem very clean. The room size was nice as it was basically a one bedroom apartment with a full kitchen and bathroom. Nice to have a pool and parking (valet and about 30 bucks a night). Nice to have laundry machines on every floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel and Philadelphia is a lovely city.”
Reviews.Author: mattfromlancs
Reviews.Content: Rooms are excellent: Large bedroom with big TV and comfy bed; well equipped kitchen, bathroom and walk in wardrobes; decoration is pretty good. Location is excellent: Shops and restaurants close by; short walk to museums; chinatown and nice restaurant and shopping area. 1.5- 2 miles to the old town and Penn's landing; 3 blocks to subway. We paid a little over $100 per night and at that price it is a bargain. I read a negative review which paid $200 per night and at that price you would probably be disappointed but not totally ripped off. Nitpicks: Room was slightly dated, in need of redecoration it its to stay at high quality, Wifi is spotty, stingy on the free coffee. DO NOT eat at the pub in the hotel under any circumstances, its awful.

Reviews.Title: “Two day family getaway to visit the sights.”
Reviews.Author: Justwantedtomention
Reviews.Content: First, I had gone to the www.visitphilly.com site and found the special overnight rates which included free parking. I wanted a family suite with a kitchen and living room/bedroom which would sleep up to six. Great location with bus stops nearby.. The front desk goes above and beyond. Super nice. The rooms are dated, but I knew that whenI booked. Who cares? I figured we are going sight seeing and would only be in the room at bedtime. And, if you check some of the other hotels nearby, they are only rates 3 stars as well. You might be able to get a cheap rate on discount sights, but that doesn't include the parking. Try to do the overnight philly rate, which has free parking.. We would stay here again. Within walking distance of the Franklin Institute, The Academy of Natural Sciences,etc.. The hotel is round so the rooms are not square. The living room area has a double sleeper sofa, chair, desk, armoire with tv, dining table, snack counter, frig, dish washer (bring liquid dishsoap), oven, microwave, toaster, etc. One bathroom which is sufficient. The bedroom has two double beds, chair, tv,etc. A large balcony which you can enter from bedroom or living room area which overlooks Ben Franklin Parkway.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Suitophobia
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are really big and the kitchen was adequate, although missing some of the essentials. The staff clean your room very well everyday and replace things like coffee and dishwashing powder. It is most definitely not faultless but good enough for the price. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you make reservations for the right kind of suite”
Reviews.Author: diningout02
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with our grandson, booking the room through expedia. After reading the reviews here we thought it would work great with a 9 year old, but when we arrived we learned the "queen suite" we reserved meant a queen sized room with full kitchen, not the separate living area people are referring to here. Unfortunately there wasnt a larger room available for our first night, but a complimentary rollaway fit into one of the large closets. They had a full suite with abalcony ready for us the second night. The staff was friendly and accommodating through all of this. Our grandson loved the pool and balcony and all the views of people working on nearby steeples and rooftops. Beware the breakfasts at the Irish pub in the hotel. Service was awful - it good 3 requests to get glasses of water, and the wait fir our food was so long it took over an hour. Good news - Au Bon Pan is around the corner. Bad news, we didn't see that till after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Ugliest Room ever”
Reviews.Author: rayhal
Reviews.Content: My wife and my two kids were making fun of me because I chose this place. Thankfully we stayed for two nights only. The Hotel looks like it has not been remodeled since 1981. The carpets look old, there was a kitchen in our room really ugly looking and outdated. All the phone, TV and internet wires could be seen running visible over the walls. I am sure you can get a better deal at the Embassy Suites which was right across the street from this hotel. The decoration was old and the lobby looked very outdated. People were nice. Outside temperature was 103 F and the A/C was not cooling the room properly. It is an old A/C system that needs upgrading. The location was close to the museums but a good walk from the Independence Hall. There is an Irish Pub and an Asian Restaurant at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge rooms, convenient, and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AreWeThereYet3_11
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and were checked in imediately. We were also pleasantly surprised and given an upgrade. Huge suite. Nice location and great views. Clean and spacious. What made this stay very nice was the staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had an unexpected issue, but they took care of us”
Reviews.Author: smittyd23
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 nights at the Windsor Suites. But after a day of sightseeing all we wanted to do was check in and pass out. Unfortunately, we were told that they didn't have a room for us. There was a water pipe leak that had ruined a number of rooms. We were less than pleased, but thankfully they set us up with a room at the neighboring Sheraton. We were set up with a fine room there and when we returned to the Windsor Suites we were greeted with an upgraded room and a free breakfast. It wasn't the most ideal situation of switching hotels, but we were treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room”
Reviews.Author: tpsnow
Reviews.Content: This hotel has lots going for it - large rooms with well appointed kitchen and everything you need. It has conveniently located laundry facilities, ice maker and vending machines. There's a pool on the roof - not luxurious but great to cool off on a hot Philly day. Location is quite convenient - you can walk into town, museums nearby and a number of very good restaurants in walking distance. There is a bar downstairs that is great for a quiet drink. Staff seemed friendly - although we didn't interact much. It is a little tired and dated but this is a small downside to an otherwise satisfactory hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay again? Maybe - maybe not.”
Reviews.Author: dijimbob
Reviews.Content: Hits: #1 is the Font Desk staff = outstandingly knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. Location = within walking distance of many museums. Public transportation is handy; SEPTA and Phlash within three minute walk. Big Bus tour stop is 5 minute walk from the front door. Room = large with full kitchen, comfortable bed, swivel HD flat screen TV, walk out balcony with great views dependent upon room location. Quiet air conditioning system. Quiet room with no noise from any neighbors or hallway traffic. Access to the elevator from the lobby is with room key for added security. Nice touch! Plenty of closets - yes that a plural. Misses: Waiting for elevators during normal business hours seemed eternal. At night and during the early part of the day it was quicker. Small thing, but there is only one mirror outside of the bathroom. It is on the bathroom door in a hall with no lighting of its own. Way too dark to use the mirror. Breakfast in the on-site restaurant is too expensive and offers too small a variety of food. We walked two short blocks (3 minutes) over to the Embassy Suites and paid $10 for a full breakfast buffet. Typical Embassy Suites breakfast offerings that include all your beverages. A great value at $10. Valet parking is very convenient, but waiting for your car when they are busy is annoying - especially when your car is brought down in the one exit lane and you wait for everyone in front of you to get everything into their car and move on. Must have waited 15 minutes each time we tried to leave the hotel. However - taking advantage of the hotel's special package that includes free parking does take some of the sting out of the experience. Hotel parking is on the 17th St side immediately around the corner from the hotel entrance. I only write this because the Android Navigation on my smartphone kept telling me to take the turn before the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic Suite”
Reviews.Author: PlanetR
Reviews.Content: Seriously surprised at how enormous our room is... I'm here now. It's a one bedroom suite with a full living room, dining area and kitchen. A balcony overlooks the city. The furnishings are nice enough, not fancy, but comfortable. The towels are plush and seem new. Internet connection is pretty bad. No complimentary breakfast like in the chain hotels. We have 3 huge walk in closets. Laundry machines are $2 /wash and $2 to dry across the hall on our floor. 2 of each machine, handy if you need to throw in a load. The pool on the 24th floor roof was very refreshing after a very hot day of sightseeing. We are here to visit University of Pennsylvania and couldn't be more pleased with our selection.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigpaJacksonville_FL
Reviews.Content: This is my sixth or seventh visit to the Windsor in the past 2 years. The personnel are so warm and friendly and there has been virtually no turn over in the past 2 years. Angela in reservations is extremely helpful everytime I book a room. The front desk are cheerful and make me feel so comfortable and remember me every visit. This last visit I ran into Sharon the previous breakfast room attendent who is now a housekeeper. She gave me a big hug and told me next time I come to the Windsor she'd make me breakfast. We had a lovely suite on the 14th floor which had a brand new bed. I slept great for my 2 night visit. Housekeeping was accommodating when we asked for extra towels and coffee.I love this place and will be back soo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for small kids! Lots of space & great location.”
Reviews.Author: SoFlaFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment here for three nights with an infant, 5 year old and 8 year old. It was really perfect. There were THREE huge walk in closets and we put the crib (borrowed from hotel) in one of them to make a separate "room" for the baby. We gave the kids the pull out sofa and ordered a roll-away bed when they started fighting over who was kicking who! It gave us plenty of space. The dishwasher made it easy to clean bottles and prepare quick snacks/meals. We were on the 20th floor with a gorgeous balconey. The bathroom was small but very nice. My husband and I both used the gym, which had the basic equipment and was pretty up to date. One complaint: WIFI was awful. But we were there for vacation and to visit family, not business, so we made do. Also, the beds weren't all that comfortable. I still would stay there again in a heartbeat if traveling with all three kids! No other place like it in Center City at that rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Its near everthing and you are eager to go”
Reviews.Author: dweissnj
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why I am reviewing, as everything recent reviewers say is true. Its a great location for the museums, parks and we walked to Independence Hall without problems. Ate only 1 breakfast at the hotel, and only because it was included in our package. It was in the bar at high tables and the server seemed like she was up all night with the weekend crowd. The room was bigger and dingier than I expected. Lots of space and the beds were really quite comfortable. The towels seemed like they went through 500 wash cycles. Hey, its less expensive than most of the alternatives and we weren't looking to splurge this time, so I would overall say it was priced rather properly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Ex50
Reviews.Content: I read all these nice reviews and booked the hotel. However, this is the worst hotel experience I ever had. In my view, the room service doesn't exist in this hotel. At 5 pm they suggested us new towels, that's it. Internet connection reminds me of the early 90s. The speed is so slow, that you won't be able to even check your email. The heating system is very old, and it barely works. The room size is fine and it is relatively close to the attractions but it is not worth 200$ per night. In addition, the parking rate is quite high. I will never recommend this horrible hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on having wifi”
Reviews.Author: bvlenci
Reviews.Content: This hotel has spacious rooms, big closets, and a full kitchen.The location is excellent, and the staff very helpful. The lack of reliable wifi was a big disappointment. I was able to connect to it with my smart phone, but not with my laptop. (It's not the fault of the laptop, because there was no problem connecting to wifi at two other hotels on the same trip, and at an airport on the trip home.) I assume that there was a required setting, but no one at the hotel had a clue. With the smart phone, the connection was so slow as to be useless. There are two computers in the lobby, which guests can use for 45 minutes at a time. This is not really sufficient for a hotel. I live in Europe and had hoped to use Skype at the hotel, but it was impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Too Good To Be True!”
Reviews.Author: afratidee
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly impressed with the accommodations at Windsor Suites. I read mixed reviews and decided to take a chance. The hotel staff was accommodating and helpful when we had to call the front desk. The rooms were spacious, more than I could have imagined and the location was perfect. I wish we could of stayed longer but under the circumstances (funeral) had to get back to California. I definitely recommend this hotel!! We plan to return when the weather is warmer!

Reviews.Title: “SAGE Teen Girls 7th Annual Retreat to Philadelphia - 4th yr at Windsor”
Reviews.Author: Sageycakes
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Suites is a great practical place for families. The rooms are spacious with great closet space. I take 20 adolescent and college aged girls to Philadelphia every January for a rededication retreat to their Sisterhood of SAGE. They love the microwaves, refrigerators and balconies. The Windsor Suite staff is always accomodating to our groups. The suites are particularly useful if you are traveling with big groups. We had five standard rooms with double beds and one suite that served at the meeting space. While there were a few complaints from other guests in the hotel regarding noise, the Windsor staff were understanding of the fact that we had 20 teen girls and appeased the guests and the girls quieted down. LOCATION IS EXCELLENT & central to most things in the city while still being slightly isolated. Snacks and food purchased from Wawa around the corner were useful too. I highly recommend this hotel especially if you are traveling with children and teens.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked This Hotel, Save for a Few Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: MrsMALinVA
Reviews.Content: My husband, son (7 y,o.) and I just returned from our trip to Philly where we stayed at the Windsor Suites for 3 nights. When searching for a place to stay, I wanted 2 things: 1) a suite with a separate bedroorm and a pull out sofa or room for a rollaway bed, and 2) to be able to walk to the main Philadelphia attractions. After painstakingly researching lodging in Center City, we originally booked at the Embassy Suites, which is basically right next door to the Windsor but cancelled my reservation when I realized they wanted $42 PER NIGHT for parking my vehicle AND because they wanted $11 PER DAY for Internet access. After further research, I finally found the Windsor and a package that included parking. Internet access is also free here. I was saving money - great! Overall, we are very happy with the hotel itself. The hotel is older and the suites reflect that to a point. For example, the bathroom was nicely updated but the door and jambs were old and had several coats of paint on them. Also, the door hinges were rusty - they could have spent a few extra $$ on new hinges and hardware, The kitchen was outdated but it was clean and worked just fine for our purposes - I don't need granite countertops in my hotel room. Let's see......there was a big stain on the carpet in one of our rooms and the pull-out sofa wasn't the most comfy to sit on, but we didn't spend much time sitting around anyway. Another reviewer complained about noise from outside the hotel. This hotel is in the center of one of the largest cities in the United States - you are going to hear horns honking, busses driving by and other typical city noises. We were on the 9th floor and we heard noise, but nothing that kept us awake. however, I do agree that the walls are very thin and I did have to call the front desk about our neighbor's TV being "too loud". I honestly don't think they realize it was loud enough to bother anyone else, but the front desk took care of it right away and everything was fine. Noise from the hallway also travelled into the room but it wasn't a problem for us. An indoor pool would have been nice, but that sure wasn't a deal breaker. The view from our HUGE balcony was a great city view as promised. Not the Philly skyline, but enough to let you know you're in a big, historical city. Location coudln't have been better: 5 blocks from Reading Term. Market, 2 blocks from City Hall, 2 blocks from Franklin Institute and Museum of Natural Sciences and maybe 6 blocks from the Art Museum. Ben Franklin Parkway was designed to mimic the Champs Elysees in Paris and, let me tell you, it's quite a beautiful sight! My only real complaint about the hotel was that the customer service was sometimes lacking. Just about everyone was very polite, friendly and professional, but 2 individuals at the front desk weren't as helpful as I felt they could be. I was having problems accessing the hotel's Internet and, on Sunday, the young lady at the front desk told me that the engineer wasn't in yet. I was going to have to call back, rather than her taking my info and asking the engineer to call me. Later on I called and spoke to a young man who told me the engineer didn't come in on Sundays! I told him I was now going on 2 days without Internet and that I would expect some sort of adjustment to my bill if I couldn't access something that was supposed to be a major, free amenity at the hotel. He flat out told me that they would not be able to give me any kind of discount for not being able to access the Internet, despite the fact that was one of the 2 reasons we switched hotels from the Embassy Suites! We left the hotel for awhile and whenI came back in, I asked that same gentleman at the front desk if anything could be done about my Internet problem. Suddenly, the engineer was in! He came up and fixed my problem and all was good. So, in short, the hotel is a bit older but it's clean and rather nice. Staff might need a few pointers in customer service but, overall, everyone was very helpful and seemed to enjoy working there and working with the guests. The valet parking staff was great, too, and took good care of our oversized pick up! I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive yes, but no value”
Reviews.Author: laslototh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Windsor Suites for one night in December. We chose this hotel based on its location and its inexpensive rates, as well as the generally positive reviews here. Our room was clean, but really worn. The carpet had bare spots and the kitchen area looked like it was last update about 20 years ago. The bathroom was newer but small, and the shower didn't drain well. The valet parking was slow - we took our car out twice and waited about 15 minutes each time. All this was somewhat acceptable given the price. What was not acceptable was the noise at night. Although we were on the 7th floor, we could easily hear street sounds. And we could also hear normal conversation from the room next door. We finally fell asleep only to be awoken at 3am by two guys knocking on each door on the floor looking for their buddy. Not good. When I complained on checkout, they removed the parking charge from our bill. I would have rather gotten a decent night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NandD1609
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Windsor Suites for four days and we LOVED it! Location was perfect. The studio-style room was huge and immaculate, and we had a great view. The kitchen was clean and fully-stocked with utensils, etc. The staff was great- cheerful, helpful, polite. The front desk workers were especially accommodating and very attentive to anything we needed. The only small problem we had was that it took a couple of requests to get new towels, but considering how excellent the rest of our stay was I wouldn't consider that much of a problem. In all, this hotel was not only wonderful considering the *extremely* low price we got it for, it was wonderful overall. We plan to stay next time we go to Philadelphia, too.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: CTYankee47
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting anything more than a bedroom and entered a "mini-apartment" !!! Had I been planning to stay for a week or longer, it would have been quite bearable. As it was, my 2 day stay was too short to be able to take full advantage of all that was at my disposal. The staff, from the doorman to the housekeeping staff and the desk staff, were very courteous, helpful and super friendly. I was unhappy with my "room service" breakfast, ordered from Con Murphy's. Most times, if you order pancakes, they tend to be the standard, light and fluffy variety. Nope, these were apparently charcoal broiled since each of 3 cakes were charred on one side and tough as "Frisbies". The Guest book was helpful but did not have a complete menu for breakfast or other meals. My only other "negative" experience was that there was no hot water in the evening if one desired to shower or soak in the tub. This definitely would have been a plus for me as I was looking forward to a nice hot shower to warm up after having to walk through the blizzard on Monday, 27 Dec. In spite of all of this, I still consider my stay at Windsor Suites to be exceptional and look forward to possibly returning in the late spring/early summer.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location and value”
Reviews.Author: SpecialBeach
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, wonderful staff who were both helpful, approachable and genuinely willing to offer any guidance to guest visiting the city. Although the style of the rooms is a little dated by some standards, they are huge (suite with kitchen facilities). You will also be hard pressed fir a better located hotel with such ease of access to many of the big points if interests in the city (on the Flash route, easily walkable to the Museum of Art, Franklin Inatitute, Eastern State Penn., Love Statue, City Hall and loads more). Great hotel in a great city. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: niyog8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Windsor after attending a dinner in Philadelphia. As soon as we walked into the hotel, we were greeted by a friendly staff. We received a free upgrade - and we were blown away by our room. The hallway included a walk-in closet; the bedroom had its own closet, as well; the kitchen was clean and well-stocked with cooking and dining ware; the living room was comfortable and included a flat screen TV - even the bathroom was beautiful! We loved the balcony and its view of Saints Peter and Paul Cathedral, too. Everything was clean and comfortable, making us wish we could stay longer than over night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: CASEY662
Reviews.Content: While this is not the most modern or luxurious hotel, the price was fairly reasonable (except for the additional charge for parking which I thought was a bit excessive) and as everyone has mentioned, it is a great location for walking to many of the sights. I thought that for the most part the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the addition of the small kitchen and large walk in closet made it feel like a studio apartment rather than a hotel room. I agree with the person that stated that the area was rather noisy-not the fault of the hotel ; the "neighbors" seemed to be up all night, but it was the weekend of the play offs so....... I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kims018
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of so many places, including the Phlash line and the subway station, that it can't be beat. The rooms are spacious and it is like staying in your own little apartment while you are away from home. We loved having a kitchen we could use and a dining room table to sit at. Being able to walk out onto the balcony and enjoy fresh air and the scenery was a nice touch too. The only thing I would have changed about the entire layout is the bathroom. I would have cut down the size of the bedroom walk-in closet and made the bathroom just a little bigger, but other than that, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value--a great "find" in Philadelphia”
Reviews.Author: BBOB-NYC
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable hotel for my daughter and me to stay at on vacation. This hotel seemed good and we were very pleased. The staff was great, very nice and helpful (with no exceptions). The room was big, had a full kitchen, and a remodeled bathroom. WIFI in the room worked well and the beds were comfortable. The location is great, walking distance to most anything you'd want to go to. We ended up leaving our car parked and walked everywhere, once and a while taking the bus. The pool was nice, on the roof, but unheated. If you swim late in the day, it gets pretty cold, so go earlier if you swim.

Reviews.Title: “Room bigger than my old apartment...”
Reviews.Author: bellkite
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia with a pair of plane tickets. We stayed three nights as part of a three day weekend. As part of the Expedia package, I'd say the room was a little less than $100 a night. It was the best value I could find. The location was very nice. Within walking distance to all the major sights. Very close to city hall and the art museum. I would recommend Eastern State Penitentiary, which isn't too far a walk away. It is massive, old prison built around 1830 that shut down in the 70's. The first of its kind and rather creepy. Steve Buscemi gives the audio tour. http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60795-d102763-Reviews-Eastern_State_Penitentiary-Philadelphia_Pennsylvania.html Now don't let my reference to prisons taint my endorsement of the the Windsor Suites. The size of our room was far from cell like. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. They even looked up a restaurant we were trying to find for us.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly management”
Reviews.Author: TANewbie24
Reviews.Content: This place has comfortable beds, and a good cleaning crew. But, the rooms are old and there are several issues. The hotel only has wi-fi on two floors and an ethernet cable in the others. However, our cable internet didn't work the entire time we were there. Also, you can't control the room temperature in the summer nor will they heat the pool (it was freezing!). To make matters worse, when I complained about a mistake they had made on the bill (not everyone at the front desk is trained with the same information) and stated I probably won't stay at the Windsor again, management didn't care. They argued with me about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: behindthesewalls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. It was great. the room was really big and we had two big walk in. The bed was really good. The location is really perfect you can see the love park and then you can see the rocky stairs. I have only two complains. The first one is the internet. The windsor has only the ethernet connection, no wifi. So if you have two laptops or you have itouch you can't use them. Some of our friends get the wifi in their room, but no luck for us! Also, some people I know get the marriott for 60$ a night when we paid 120$ a night. I know that if you stay more than 3 nights it's going to be cheaper like 80$ a night, so it's no that bad. Also the pool at the rooftop is amazing! Great room service too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, big rooms, good sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: DuFFi_SK
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel only for one night. It was a pitty, because the hotel was perfect. It was clean, the staff was nice, the room big with perfect view from the balcony and with full kitchen. We had room wich was almost as big as our flat in Slovakia :-) It had full kitchen, living room with big flat TV, two closets, bathroom and big bedroom with nice bed. Wi-fi internet was complimentary, but parking was valet for almost 30 dollars per night. The hotel is reasonable priced and good located (5 minutes from 15th Street metro station), but they are lot of homeless people especially near the JFK Plaza so be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but would seek another hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancouverValleyGrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our trip and were pleased with the rooms both times (room 614 and then 606). Both rooms had extremely LOUD plumbing when flushing. Elevators were SLOW (one of the 3 was out of order on our first stay), but desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking was very pricey at $25 a day. Room 606 had a nice balcony (no outside furniture) and the next-door Embassy Suites had a loud party with DJ and mic on their rooftop. Outdoor pool (24th floor) is unheated and COLD even on hot nights. There is a Wawa's on 17th and JFK (right around the corner) to grab food and water. Having the kitchen was wonderful in such hot weather to store our drinks and perishables.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great service!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlWashington
Reviews.Content: This is a great place with a great location -- 10 minute walk to the Franklin Institute, 20-30 minutes to the Independence Hall historic area, with lots of other stuff in between. From the first phone call to checkout, the service we received during our 4-night stay was cheerful, friendly, personable and extremely helpful. Every staff person we met (every one!) was eager to help and went above and beyond our expectations (which are pretty high) to answer our questions and respond to our needs. They made it a fun place to stay. Our room was on the 6th floor, with a balcony (no extra charge) overlooking the Benjamin Franklin Parkway -- great views of the Saints Peter and Paul Cathedral, fountains and the parkway. Sitting on the balcony made for great people-watching in the mornings and evenings. The room was big, with a big walk-in closet and full kitchen (stove, dishwasher, fridge, microwave) that made it easy to walk to the nearby (10 minute walk) Whole Foods for breakfast and dinner food if we wanted to eat in. It was very quiet and comfortable and the beds were just fine. The swimming pool (on the roof top) and the laundry room were added pluses for our family. This hotel is definitely not new, but is well maintained and feels very comfortable and homey. You can tell that they're making upgrades along the way and it's really a nice place. It's not as posh as some places, but for us, it was perfect. I'd trade posh for excellent service, convenient location and comfortable rooms any day.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: It is funny how different experiences we can have.... We stayed three nights and were overall pleased. Room was huge and clean (7th floor), beds comfortable, service fine, and location great. The hotel is close to lots of restaurants and it is WALKING distance everywhere, including to the old town, Independence Hall, all the museums, the University district, and the Amtrak station. Having a rooftop pool was perfect in the heat, and we also worked out everyday in the gym. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: M0llyR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "suite" and had the worst hotel experience ever! Dirty rooms, furniture had what looked like blood stains, sleeper sofa should have been thrown away 25 years ago and had it's own plethora of stains and smells. Rude front desk could not care less why I checked out early. Valet is a joke, you get your own luggage dolly, load your luggage on it and then ask the front desk to bring it up to your room. Parking attendant hides in a small room watching tv. I would rather sleep in my car!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Philly”
Reviews.Author: jbalchr
Reviews.Content: The Windsor Suites is the best value in Philly. It is right in the heart of the museum district, close to City Hall and just a short subway ride to the historic district. The hotel is an older one, but the rooms are immaculately kept and maintained, and the staff is by far the very best. The room we had was a queen suite with a small kitchen and a LARGE walk in closet. We parked our car in the garage and the valet staff was efficient and friendly. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Philly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BayBob
Reviews.Content: We came to visit our daughter in Philadelphia and stayed two nights at the Windsor Suites Hotel. Our room was large with a kitchen, nice TV (limited channels) and the bathroom was newly renovated. The staff was excellent, always helpful and asking if there was anything they could do for us. We didn't know it until we arrived but the two days we were there, there was a Flyers Stanley cup game, a Phillys double header and a huge bike race, so the hotel was full. We did not have a balcony room like I had hoped, but because of everything that was going on, we were lucky to have a room at all. With everything this hotel has going for it, the greatest thing about it is the location! It is only 2-3 blocks from City Hall, which is the center of the city. Much of what you will want to do is walkable from the hotel and everything else is only a $5-$10 cab ride away. The roof-top pool seems rather small and claustrophobic, we did not have time to use it but the guests with kids seemed to enjoy it. There is a small pub and an Asian restaurant on the property with a Starbucks, TGI Fridays and several bars within one block and a WAWA food store around the corner. BTW, if you are coming to party hardy, don't bother. They make you sign a no party or loud noise after 9pm agreement, which is much applauded by all who want peace and quiet. Also there is absolutely no smoking in the rooms, in any area of the hotel or within 20 feet of it on the street. When we come back to visit longer we will certainly stay at the Windsor Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value in the Best Location in Philadelphia”
Reviews.Author: FairCritique
Reviews.Content: For a $90 Priceline bid I stayed 5 nights in a clean, comfortable and pleasant environment. This hotel is not for prissy fussbudgets, since the trivial "amenities" are not provided as in such hotels as Westin and Hyatt. However, it provides a way to economize and still enjoy a better class of property. The kitchen in the "suite" affords one the option of having breakfast in, or a dinner or two that has been prepared at a food market and that is simply popped into the microwave. My room was extremely quiet, the bed very comfortable, the bathroom newly renovated and in perfect working condition. I did have two small issues that kept me from giving this property the full 5 star rating. Cigarette smoke occassionally wafted into the bathroom via the vent. Also, the "free wi-fi" is not available in the room, only in the lobby and lower lobby, and I was not able to connect no matter what. The Front Desk person did not bother to investigate this. But there is a business center with high-speed access. Again, there is not access from the guest rooms. But knowing this now, I would still return to this hotel, regardless of that little inconvenience, if the rate remains about what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, great location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: 50yoVermonter
Reviews.Content: We just had a great trip to Philadelphia with our two teenagers. The Winsor Suites is very roomy and suited us just fine. I was well informed through other Trip Advisor reviews of it's sort comings. I will confirm what others before me have written. It is poorly sound proofed. Early one morning we could hear a baby fussing in the next room, but we had babies many years ago and I was just glad it wasn't mine. The cleaning crew could definitely do a better job. I would give them a C- as a grade. For example the carpets are not cleaned behind the doors, or next to the baseboard. If your house is absolutely spotless then you might want to stay elsewhere. The kitchen is adequate, I like the mini dishwasher. It does have plates, bowls, glasses, silverware ect. but very little cookware. If you intend to cook much, bring pots, pans etc. We just used the microwave to make scrambled eggs and it was fine. I look forward to visiting Philly again and will probably stay at the Winsor again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: UMichAlum
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel by any means but it is perfectly ok if a bit quirky. The queen room must have once been a studio apartment...nice little kitchen. But there is no table nor straight chairs for one to sit on and at to eat. Housekeeping was ok but could be better. Drains ran slow. Bed was comfortable. The hotel is definitely not a dump and is priced very reasonably for being in center city. Would we return? Probably not (especially if the really good b&b's had vacancies. We reserved very late and there were no vacancies of that type).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: IslandDreams
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful-- for only $99 a night. Rooms were incredibly spacious (nice kitchenette, dishwasher, table, desk, easychair, 2 closets, 2 beds) and very clean. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The Irish Pub connected to the lobby is a lively spot on weekend evenings, and provides a convenient place to grab delicious breakfast as well. Centrally located just a block from the famous "LOVE" and city hall, this is where I will be staying in Philly for the forseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE !!! Philly Overnight charges becomes Travelocity with NO free parking !!!”
Reviews.Author: Overcharged18
Reviews.Content: I booked The Windsor with a package deal called "Philly Overnight" where the customer gets a Brag Book, a SMALL teddy bear, and (Most-importantly) FREE PARKING which is normally $31/ night! I apparently got my reservation switched to Travelocity when I saw a good rate! I checked with the desk at The Windsor Suites and I was guaranteed the lower rate AND free parking for two nights. The desk manager switched the reservation to Travelocity and I was "out" $31 x 3 nights. Only after annoying the desk did I receive the Brag Book of Philly facts and the 2-inch teddy bear; the $93 charge for parking was mine to "eat". I left with a good attitude but I believe that I was over-charged for the parking. I (and all that read this review) get the LAST SAY; I don't have to return to The Windsor Suites in Philadelphia. Check-out misleading rates before you book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome surprise in Center City Philadelphia”
Reviews.Author: Oxer
Reviews.Content: I decided at the last minute to go to my meeting the night before to avoid traffic in the morning. I noted that in other reviews, noise had been sited as a negative. When I enquired about price and avilability, I asked for a quiet room. I booked a room with one queen bed. Reservations were made very easily and professionally in a friendly manner. The hotel is in the north part of downtown with parking adjacent for an additional fee which included the day of my meeting. Staff was attentive, friendly and accommodating. They held my luggage for the day after I checked out. My accomodations were clean, comfortable and quiet. Interesting set up with a coat closet, a linen closet and a walk in closet as well as a small full kitchen. One could stay there for an extended period comfortably. An older building which has been updated and maintained. Not fancy, but more than fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but little details looked over.”
Reviews.Author: 00teggyls
Reviews.Content: Pros: Walking into the lobby is very beautiful. Amazing staff, they were a helpful and prompt service. The level of security made us feel very safe (had to use your room key to get access to the elevator). Beds were very comfortable. Hallways were quiet. Valet parking was nice to have, didn't have to worry about finding a place to park. You can take your car in and out of the garage as many times as you want. Bathrooms were amazing, very up to date. The bath handles were old fashioned with a modern appeal. Flat screen t.v's. Pool is there, but used seasonally. Fitness center that has 24/7 access (treadmills and weights). Two restaurants in the hotel with room service. Room came with utensils. Large closets, we had 2 walk-ins and a linen closet. Cons: Parking costs way too much. We weren't even there for 24 hours and had to pay $31.01 - hotel should pro-rate for guests staying one night. In the queen bed suites the kitchen was blocked off and very small. The appliances were very out of date (fridge, dishwasher and stove/oven). Wasn't informed that you had to ask for cookware (sauce pans, cutting board, cooking sheet). We went down to the front desk and told them we had no cookware and it was then they informed us that you had to ask for them. When we got the cooking sheet it was too big for the oven (the width of the oven was very small) . Couldn't close the door with the cooking sheet. Called the front desk back and asked for a smaller size, they told us they didn't have any more (out of 200+/- rooms?). The room felt out dated. The wall paper was turning brown from age. The dishwasher had rust. We smelled smoke at random times in the night, in our smoke-free room (almost as if someone was in our room smoking). Probably from the past. There was no thermostat in the room. The heating unit in our room was very old. You had to go over to the unit and lift a panel and turn the knobs (which were dusty and very old looking). We booked our room on their website almost a month in advance and when we arrived, they informed us that they didn't have any single-bed rooms only double (but they were able to find us a room). Overall is was an okay stay, but personally we wouldn't stay again and not reccomend this hotel to any friends.

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient location, friendly staff, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: classicalgazz
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean large rooms, fast and friendly service, easy walking distance to the CBD and museums. Pleasant longer walks to historical areas. Pleasant quiet room on the 11th fl at back of hotel. We had no car, just walked and bussed. Con: Slightly smokey smell in carpet in hallways from a long time past. But still, very liveable and great value. Breakfast included ! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Windsor”
Reviews.Author: bigpaJacksonville_FL
Reviews.Content: We love the Windsor. We stayed 12-29-09 to 12-31-09. We feel like we are family and were greeted with a "Welcome Back" gift consisting of a coffee mug filled with candy. The rooms are spacious and we would not weven consider staying anywhere else. Angela in reservations gave us the room we requested. As usual our expectations were met and more with the hotel. We stayed there July also and can't wait to come back in Feb.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reliable”
Reviews.Author: irishgalinabq
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and sisters to explore Philadelphia. The weather was really bad while we were here so we spent more time in the hotel than we usually would. However, as the suites are so spacious there was plenty of room for us to hang out together in one room and the bar downstairs gave us a further outlet. The food was also really good in the bar downstairs. When we did go out, we walked to most of the attractions and shops that were nearby but we got a taxi to go down to Independence park. Both rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. They also gave us rooms next to each other. We got a great rate for the rooms even though it was close to Christmas. I agree with some of the other posts on here-you do have to wait a bit for the elevators and the parking is pretty pricey. However, for us the parking was worth it as we didn't have to drive around a strange city looking for parking in bad weather. I have re-booked this hotel for our next trip to Philly as they had a great package with tickets to Bodyworlds and a free breakfast so my husband and i are looking forward to our next adventure.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: rduinc
Reviews.Content: Although a little dated you can not trade the excellant service and proce for some of the pricer hotels in center city. We actually stayed at the Ritz the two ngihts before and were charged for internet access which was free and easy at the Windsor.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Parking OK rate for downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: FormsanRunner
Reviews.Content: Parking in downtown Philly is expensive. The rooms were up to par with 3 1/2 star hotel rating. If you pay a little bit more than 100 bucks for this hotel then it is OK, any more than that I would consider a hotel near the airport because the airport isn't that far from downtown. Walking distance from this hotel to Independence Hall is still good 25 mins, walking to Reading Terminal market is 15 mins or so. Rooms were clean, complimentary breakfast incluced but you better go down early because the cafe is small, might have problem finding a table. The valet parking takes forever, waiting for you car for 10 minutes or so is normal.

Reviews.Title: “great package”
Reviews.Author: accomodater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Great package deal included lots of inclusions, including parking, internet, breakfast, gym, at about half the nightly price of other hotels. Big room (studio apartment really), good bed, big TV, friendly service and great central location. Not 5 star luxury but definitely 4 star and no rip-off charges. Will please tourists and business persons.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PRICE, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: isabella619
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and 4 days. When we arrived the front desk was very gracious and kind and we felt very welcomed. When we walked into the room I was surprised how huge it was! There was tons of space! The kitchenette was an awesome bonus. We also had a great view of Love Park from our balcony! We were walking distance from Reading Terminal, the Liberty Bell, museums and the infamous Rocky steps. I was also delighted with the free breakfast in the morning. Nothing fancy but it does the job if you don't want to spend extra money during your stay for a meal. I highly recommend this hotel for families, couples or business travelers alike. The location and the value we received does not compare to a lot of hotels. Not to mention that we just enjoyed staying somewhere convenient, safe and comfortable. Thank you Windsor Suites... !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the independently-minded”
Reviews.Author: ChocMoose
Reviews.Content: Spend two weeks here on business and wanted somewere self-catering, so I wasn't eating out the whole time. Not bad location wise; was about a 20 minute walk to my location and was fairly centrally located for other things. Bit of a hike with shopping from the nearest supermarket, but there is a wine store nearby and a couple of good restaurants, such as the Mexican place just across the road. Main advantage of the room was the kitchen area; rooms were otherwise a little on the tired side and could do with some refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Great! Will stay here again for sure.”
Reviews.Author: DUBBLE_J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last April for a good friends wedding and could not have been more pleased. Excellent location for sightseeing some of the historic parts of PHL. The room was clean as a whistle and newly updated. Great shower! Free breakfast was a plus and the Balcony had an excellent view! I would book here again in a heartbeat! I don't understand the negative reviews and I guess some people think a $100+ room rate should be like the Four Seasons. LOL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and great room”
Reviews.Author: Bliv0904
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for his 21st birthday! It has an easy walk to South street (where all the bars are) and Broad st! The staff was great! We were a few hours early and they let us check in with no problems. I called the service desk one night to ask for a cab company # so I can call a cab and they told me "just come down stairs and our bell hop with hail you one". Which he did...pretty fast I should add! Also, we asked them for advice on where NOT to go and they were quick and happy to tell us. (bad parts...anything west of 23rd street and south of South st...try to avoid these areas) From 22ed st on to Penns landing is a good area! I would definitly stay at this hotel again. The room had a balcony that over looked a road (I believe cherry st) that was lined with flags. My husband and I enjoyed trying to guess the flags countries while having a smoke. (non smoking hotel). The room was clean and very large. Beds were comfortable and this room had a great price. We paid less than $100 per night! Try this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: DCS2009
Reviews.Content: just average. booking.com did not include tax on the price, which after that, was not a deal. the hotel staff didn't make up our room the whole weekend. there was a nice pool on the roof, and parking is $31. we got a room facing the back without a balcony, and the decor was quite dated.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Suites "Still Great For A Weekend Getaway"”
Reviews.Author: ssap01
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here exactly one year ago and we loved it. We have returned this year again for a weekend getaway. The room is clean. The staff is very nice. The room comes with a full kitchen which adds a very nice touch. The parking is still steap, but the rates are in line with the area. You are allowed to move your car as many times as you want.

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: de1159
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is friendly, and the room was clean but...the hotel is old, and the rooms are not suites like the pictures say. They include a little kitchenette so they say suite, but you do not get a living area with a couch,,I was disappointed. The pool is on the roof,which sounds great but its not...its cold up there and you have to walk up these stairs that are dark and dangerous. For the price of the hotel you can stay elsewhere and get a nicer room,,I think. Plus its 2 miles from the historic district.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms and balconies!”
Reviews.Author: Suzski
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Windsor Suites for a short trip to see the historical sights of Philadelphia. Our room included two double beds, a full kitchen, table, large flat screen TV, spacious closets and a nice sized bathroom. The hotel also has free WiFi and the bathroom amenities included Bath and Body Works products. We paid $109 for our first night (a Sunday) and $139 for the second (booked through the hotel website). Our spacious room also included a very large balcony that, although without chairs or tables, had a spectacular view of the Philadelphia Museum of Art (home of the "Rocky steps") to the left, and the beautiful City Hall to the right. Reading Terminal Market was a short 10 minute walk with the Historic District an additional 10 minutes away. Parking was over $30 per night but included in-and-out privileges and honestly, parking is very expensive in the city. The breakfast buffet was kept stocked by a cheerful employee and included several types of cold cereal, a waffle iron, bagels, breads, and fruit. Although the hotel would not be considered chic, it is very homey and you definitely get your money's worth in location and space. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when traveling to Philadelphia.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationsrus58
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although older, was so comfortable to stay in. Each room had a kitchen and beautifully updated bathrooms. For $40 more I upgraded my room to a suite that was worthy of being called an apartment! Huge! The staff were so friendly and servicable. The location is great...can catch the local tour bus FLASH and in walking distance to restaurants, etc. I wish we could have stayed longer. I encourage travelers to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise & you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mfl243
Reviews.Content: Was @ Windsor for 3-night, long weekend in the summer. Room was really a 1-bedroom, 1 King Bed apartment w/sitting area, dining table and chairs, large kitchenette and more closet space than my house Bath was small, but servicable, shower was large, worked well. Entire place had been updated recently. Like a previous poster, I paid for the upgrade and I think that made all the difference---in a Parkway view, a balcony and a large, well-kept place. Some rooms face out-back, toward the loading dock--the cheaper rooms. Some traffic noise can can penetrate from the Parkway, the fitness center needs updated, but is good for a short treadmill or free-weight work-out, the rooftop pool is TINY--maybe good if you have small child. Location was great, Art museum near-by, subways a few blocks away, Trader Joe's within walking distance. I'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RobfromKensington
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the Windsor Suites. For about $100 for the Friday night before the Memorial Day weekend we had a very large room on the 15th floor, with a four ring gas hob, microwave, coffee maker dishwasher and separate eating area. (In fact, apart form making coffee, we eat out - at Hirshel's East Side deli in the Reading Market (enormous pastrami sandwiches) and at the "Dover Seafood Grill" a few blocks South of the hotel, in the Rittenhouse Square area (excellent sea food!) The Windsor had pleasant helpful staff (when checking in and when storing baggage). It is in a very good location - only a short walk from City Hall, Reading Market etc. There is a pool on the 24th floor which looked great, but which we didn't use. The only downside - a bed that was a little too soft (a tendency to allow rolling to the centre!) Yes, it was $31 for the valet parking service - but it was efficient, with "in and out rights" (if you needed them) and although we checked out at 11 am, the parking charge covered the period up to 6 pm - had we wanted to stay in the city that long. And don't forget that the meters we found out of the centre by the Art Museum charged a quarter for 8 minutes (!) and the parking lot by the Museum was $10 minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Some issues, but BIG rooms, great location and impeccable service make this a winner”
Reviews.Author: Exdamyankee
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Philly I booked two nights in the Windsor Suites. The Windsor not a new building by any stretch of the imagination, but is well kept and appears to be undergoing a lot of upgrades. Large rooms seem to be the norm here, ours had a full kitchen and plenty of square footage. The bathroom looked recently updated, and although we had some plumbing issues (slow tub drain) maintenance fixed it promptly. The location at 17th & Ben Franklin, just blocks from City Hall is a huge plus, you can walk pretty much anywhere from this spot in no time at all. Service was wonderful, with competent, knowledgable and friendly people at the front desk that made doing business with this hotel a pleasure. Sure, some of the place still needs some facelifting, but the Windsor is a sturdy and comfortable old gal that makes you happy you came to visit her while in Philly. I will book there again if the rates are favorable next time I'm in town. WARNING - The parking garage is under construction at present and there is jackhammer noise in the hotel lobby and lower floors from Monday through Friday from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM. In most cases, you'll be out of the room by then so it probably won't be an issue, but forewarned is forearmed as they say. The noise on the 9th floor was not noticeable from our room, but you could hear it in the elevators when they were working. NOTE: Parking is $31 per night. That's about what my daily rental car rate was via Priceline, so factor that into your costs when planning your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: thesmiths1108
Reviews.Content: After discovering that this hotel was strickly non smoking, I asked at check in if my husband and I can have a room with a balcony. It was a $40 upgrade so we took it. But what they didnt tell you was with the upgrade you are practically staying in a 1 bedroom plush fully furnished apartment with FULL kitchen! WOW! The room was very clean and all the appliances worked well. I was surprised to see that the kitchen was also fully stocked with cookware, flatware, dinner ware and glasses. There was also a dishwasher! The Windsor Suites rents 1 bedroom apartments and I bet this is a perfect display of one. The staff was very friendly. The parking garage was under construction but you would have never known unless you were told. No noise from it at all. Would definelty stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Visit saved by good service”
Reviews.Author: laurifromMA
Reviews.Content: Our family totally prefers to stay in suite style hotels and therefore were selecting between the Embassy Suites and Windsor when planning out April vacation/college visit to Philadelphia. We had stayed in Embassy Suites in the past and never been disappointed; however, we were able to get a much better price at Windsor, and decided to give them a try. I will try to sum up a few thoughts, I hope it is helpful to someone. 1. Service at this hotel is great! Every employee is friendly and ready and willing to help. The front office manager, Patsy, went out of her way to take care of a problem that we had and checked in to make sure we were content. 2. The hotel is undergoing LOUD construction, contained to the hours of 8:30am-4:30 pm. This construction makes being in the room pretty uncomfortable, although once you are above the 8th floor, it's not too bad. If you're going to be out during the day, no problem. Ask about construction when you reserve. End date is estimated for late May. 3. Their website is useless if you want to know what the different room types mean, and when we called, the information we received didn't match reality. If you just want a big room with a full kitchen, reserve a "double/double suite". If you want a full kitchen AND a living room area, go for the "one bedroom suite". The living room does not have a full couch, so if you are used to Embassy Suites, know that going in, BUT also, you should know that the living room space is MUCH larger than what you get at Embassy. We needed a space to eat together and hang out, and were very pleased with the space of a one bedroom suite. We also had a double/double suite for part of the group, and that provides nothing for hang-out space. 4. There is a "continental" breakfast included. It is actually a fuller breakfast than you expect for continental, including cereal, bagels, fruit and waffles. However, you are only 6 blocks from Reading Terminal Market, so be sure to get there! 5. You can walk wherever you want to go from this location, so get a deal that includes parking, leave your car, and hit your sneakers! There's Trader Joe's market just a few blocks from the hotel. 6. Some rooms have balconies, and some do not. If you care about this feature, be sure to ask for one. 7. I must repeat that the service at this hotel was really good. We were greeted every time we walked in or out of the hotel, and always asked how things were going. We will definitely stay at Windsor Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Philadelphia”
Reviews.Author: msague
Reviews.Content: Big room with kitchen. Everything was very clean. Beds were super comfortable. Service was friendly. Complimentary breakfast had waffles, bagels, cereal, juice and good coffee. Great location...about 10 minute walk to the Reading Market or to the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and roomy - not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: joemess
Reviews.Content: I selected Windsor Suites mostly on price and then location. I wasn't expecting too much, but when we got there we were quite surprised. The room was very large and had a full kitchen which was great for nice breakfasts and bringing back doggie bags from dinner for a nice snack the next day. Location is pretty nice - you are close to City Hall and a few blocks from the subway. On a nice day you can stroll up Ben Franklin Blvd (the Champs Elysees of America) and catch some of the museums. The hotel is close to the historic district (5 minutes by subway) or 15 minute walk which is very convenient since we don't travel with a car - and you don't need one in Philly. The only downsides are that the rooms are a bit dated, balconies are only on some rooms in the front of the hotel (more expensive) if you want one, and free internet can be quirky. But, unless you are expecting luxury the hotel is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the parking garage”
Reviews.Author: kl5Carter
Reviews.Content: Just a warning, we left an item in our car and it was stolen from the hotel's parking lot. Upon confronting the garage and hotel about it, they just pointed to a sign that says they are not responsible for the loss of anything...

Reviews.Title: “Tons of problems”
Reviews.Author: Toro014
Reviews.Content: Internet not working in the room, problems with hot water, and they are charging me an extra $30 a night to park my car in their parking lot!

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrippingAllOver
Reviews.Content: This is not a grand, new, luxury hotel. But it is clean, well-maintained and spacious. We booked three rooms for one night for our extended family of travellers aged 7 to teens to folks in our forties and fifties. The staff is courteous and helpful, the continental breakfast is plenty, the rooms comfortable. It was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: kleefaj
Reviews.Content: Staff was courteous and professional. Parking available. Good location (near mass transit). Suite was clean, big. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inauguration Weekend/Week”
