Reviews.Author: Belben10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was AWESOME! The staff was so courteous when we asked for directions, they looked info up on the web and also pulled out a yellow page directory to help. Rooms were very nice, roomy & CLEAN! We slept like babies. Breakfast was perfect and the atttendant always greeted us with a huge smile and a "Good Morning". Garage attendant was kind & helpful when parking our rental to load up our baggage. The location is fantastic for touring Philly and also a great spot to hop the freeway and cruise out to another city. Everything about this hotel was perfect. Great job guys, and thank you so much for such great SERVICE! I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stevinazo
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Good location. Not too expenisve. Excellent staff, especially Sharon in the breakfast room. Not too far from City Hall and downtown or the art museums. An excellent value. And, the cabs are not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Chi-Philly
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Windsor even after reading peoples mixed reviews of the hotel, but I wanted to stay at a place that had a refrigerator. Well that's what I got a mixed bag. I stayed at the Windsor Suites between 09/18/08-09/23/08, I had arrived a little early before check in time but they had a room available and it was on the 11th floor rm 1114. It was the last room on the far end next to the exit staircase. When I came into the room you could tell they just got through remodeling the suite. It had new carpeting, new bed, bathroom fixtures and it was huge. The only problem was the phone didn't work, it didn't have garbage cans, and some of the kitchen ware wasn't there. So when I went down to tell the concierge that the phone wasn't working they sent up a maintenance guy. The maintenance guy was nice and he tried to see what the problem was with the phone, he left and came back telling me that they are going to put me into another room. So I'm thinking ok, not bad, so I moved my stuff and went down on the 7th floor rm 713. The room was and older model, the only thing that was remodeled was the bathroom. When I was unpacking again, apparently the concierge forgot that they had switched my room, because I heard someone enter the key card and a man came through the door. Well talk about surprise, but he was nice so we went downstairs again to straighten things out. The older model room was ok accept the bed; it was completely shot and didn't agree with my back. The staff was nice though and the breakfast in the morning was a nice bonus, I would maybe stay at the hotel again, I did get a nice deal but at least now I know what to really look for if I ever stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Value”
Reviews.Author: nyc/atlanta
Reviews.Content: Although a month out, had trouble finding any hotel for long Philadelphia weekend. Quikbook had a wonderful rate, but was suspicious as nothing else was available for almost double the price ($140-180, depending on the night). Windsor Suites turned out to be a great location - around the corner from the Four Seasons. The studio suite was comfortable, clean, had a full small kitchen (they even did the few dishes) and large closets, basic continental breakfast. No the decor was not "hot", but it was a surprisingly good choice. However, the Asian restaurant in the lobby (a very rainy night choice) is not to be recommended - better to get slightly wet and go to the Friday's around the corner for the what you know is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but disorganized staff”
Reviews.Author: moshmomma
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was in a good location and it had a midweek hotel special that included parking (which is VERY expensive in philly) for only 150.00 plus tax. I tried to book it through their email, but no one ever responded. So I called and told him the package I wanted and reserved it. He never sent a confirmation email.. no big deal I guess. But when I arrived, the person who took my reservation, was no longer there and booked the wrong room rate, 219/night w/no parking. So the girl helping me needed to talk to the manager. The key to our room, did not work, so I had to go back downstairs. She moved us up two floors? She then called me later to make sure the room was ok and told me the manager reduced the rate to 139 plus parking. I told her that did not sound right. I went online & printed THEIR package cost and detail and brought it to the desk. The manger told me he'd reduce the room another 30.00 to make up for the rate. Well in the morning it was still the same as before. In the end it all got taken care of, but it took me about 4 times to explain it and before it was right and about 20 minutes of my time, for something that should have been done right in the first place. BUT.. The staff were friendly and went overboard to accommodate us and even gave me 2 free drinks at the resturant for the headache. The room was huge. It had a fridge, microwave, huge walk in closet and bathroom. The hotel was nice, clean and the restaurant in the hotel served thai food. I didn't get to try it but their desert was awesome. The free continental breakfast in morning was good. I would recommend this place for anyone, just make sure if you book a package you get an email confirmation, to avoid any headaches upon check in/out.

Reviews.Title: “a great philly find”
Reviews.Author: millercgr
Reviews.Content: This is a truly wonderful hotel with a very pleasant staff. The suites are large, clean and comfortable. Having a full kitchen with a refrigerator is icing on the cake. The price was more than reasonable and compared to Embassy Suites (the most comparable hotel) it is a real bargain. The hotel also serves as an apartment complex, and guests must swipe their key to access the elevator. I found this absolutely more comforting and secure and not odd as another reviewer suggests. Perhaps some renovations are needed, particularly on the entrance doors. Other than that I would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you're looking to stay in downtown Philadelphia. Having an all-night sandwhich shop nearby is a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the center of philly”
Reviews.Author: marc-the-chef
Reviews.Content: Family of four stayed here during Indepence Day week, and I can't think of a single negative ething to say. It's not a new hotel, but the cleanliness and layout of the rooms was A-okay. In particular, let me note the abundance of closet space. Desk staff were pleasant and helpful. Valet parking isn't cheap, but so, so convenient. Asian restaurant at the front entrance was very nice, and so much better than schlepping over to Chinatown. For an evening stroll we could walk about 4 blocks in one direction to the City Hall, or in another through the outdoor fountains to the Museums. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: rbgs
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal for a room in this hotel. As some of the other reviews have said, it's not the most up to date property, but my room was clean and well-equipped including a hair dryer, ironing board and full kitchen (with toaster!). The beds were comfortable. It was a little noisy, but it was mainly traffic noise from the street which is to be expected in a city centre property. The continental breakfast had plenty of choices and you could take food up to your room if needed. The free wi-fi was patchy but the computers in the business centre off the lobby were much appreciated and the wired connection worked well with my friend's laptop.

Reviews.Title: “less helpful than one would expect”
Reviews.Author: Wolftracks
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Philadelphia after a long drive, we were dismayed to find that the Windsor Suites had no reservation for us. Turns out they had booked it for the previous month and had gone so far as to charge us a no-show fee for their mistake! Kind Abi at the front desk found us a room in their rather full hotel and advised us to speak with the manager, James Zhang, the next day. We had to wait around the hotel for an hour in the morning till he was out of a meeting, then he contacted us by phone. He was not helpful, acting as if it was my fault, when I know very well that I booked the room for May 18 because that was the weekend of our daughter's graduation. I was polite with him and I believe, in hindsight, that that was to my disadvantage. Some managers respond better to irate customers, as in the saying "the squeaky wheel gets the grease." He allowed us to stay in our room one more night at the $159 rate and credited the "no-show" fee back to us, but we still got an inferior room to the one I reserved-- and yet paid the same rate. I expected him to do better than that, such as waive the parking costs ($30 per day), but he clearly wanted to do as little as possible to correct the situation and made no effort to make up for the inconvenience, delay in checking in, and the distress of thinking we did not have a room in a city that was extremely short on lodging that particular weekend. In addition, the hotel's valet service drove my husband crazy, due to the poor communication of the guys working there and the lack of clarity at the front desk. We were sent from valet to desk to valet more than once. I still don't understand their parking system. The hotel room itself was adequate and well designed. The breakfast was slim pickings.

Reviews.Title: “Read this Review”
Reviews.Author: manicdev1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. As soon as we arrived at the front desk, we had experienced true quality service. We found it odd that you always had to sweep our room key to acces the elevator. Our room was spacious, with two (large) double beds, a small kitchen, balcony(covered in cigars), a few small tables, and a master bathroom. The beds are comfy. We had a problem with the showers. Apparently, you are suppoused to hit some hidden button for hotter water. We had a nice view from our window. We also had some problems with the safe. __One major con of our stay was that in the middle of the night, a fire alarm went off!!!!! It was a false alarm, which we found out happens frequently. The hotel has a 13th floor, yikes! There was a continental breakfast ever morning. It was satisfying. We loved the make your own belgian waffle. There was also many other amenities. Our room had free Wi-Fi for our laptop. Note that not all rooms have this. There's also two computers and a printer available for free. Some arcade games and food vending machines are on site. There's one vending machine with bath nescessities. The fitness center is amazing. All service here was very nice, with the exception of the concierge. They weren't able to give us a great reccomendation of a restaurant. The only restaurant at the hotel was Jappanese. We never ate there. Our stay was an A- or B+.

Reviews.Title: “A Surprising and Spacious Value”
Reviews.Author: akosz
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY - We had booked a room at the Windsor for a long weekend on a budget thinking that it would "make do" for our showering and sleeping purposes and put us in a good location downtown. We weren't expecting much more, but were pleasantly surprised at what we got for what we paid. I'm pretty sure we got "upgraded", but we weren't about to complain. And it seemed even the smaller rooms weren't too bad either. I have a lot of photos of this hotel that will be uploaded soon as well. Now for the breakdown. BEDS: One king sized bed. Not too hard, not too soft. Easily the most comfortable hotel bed I've had in years. The sheets were clean and the pillows were plentiful. BILLING: No issues, except for a little confusion between the parking attendant and the front desk, but they handled that themselves. BREAKFAST: Free continental breakfast in teh lower lobby, weekends until 10am, weekdays until 9am. Coffee, juice, milk, bagels, cereal, muffins, fruit, yogurt, and the newly popular DIY waffle-makers were provided. Free complimentary newspaper as well. CLEANING: The room was as clean as it could be for a hotel that isn't brand-spanking new. CLIMATE CONTROL: There was a thermostat in the main room and an additional heater/air conditioning unit in the bedroom. We never needed to use the separate unit, but the thermostat kept things very comfortable. ELEVATORS: 3 main elevators service 24 floors, so they were a little slow during busy hours. You need to use your room card to get on in the lobby to go up, but not to get back down. Not a bad idea, it keeps the unwanted guests out. FRONT DESK: The front desk was always very friendly and helpful, but their response time on our requests for toilet paper and extra towels was a bit slow. GYM: A modest gym is provided on the lower lobby level. It consisted of a couple of treadmills, stairclimber, bike, a set of dumbbell freeweights, and one universal weight machine. Lots of TV sets were provided with the cardio equipment to keep you from getting bored. INTERNET: Both wired and wireless, fast and free. No annoying login screens or codes to wade thru, but remember that also limits your security. JACUZZI: N/A. LOCATION: Right in the heart of downtown, blocks from city hall, the art museum, and the newly built comcast center tower. It's on the corner of Benjamin Franklin Parkway and 17th street. If you're looking to spend a lot of your time downtown it's perfect. But the trendy shops of South Street and some of the historic sites will be a hike. NOISE: The hotel itself was pretty quiet as hotels go, although we were not provided with a "do not disturb" sign. Of course it's located downtown in a major city, so there's plenty of city noise outside (horns, sirens, cars...) but it's not overwhelming. PARKING: Valet $31/night. POOL: The rooftop pool is open memorial day thru labor day. We were there in the "off season" so we did not pay it a visit. RESTAURANT: 2 on site. We patronized the chinese/thai restaurant one night and were pleased with their food and service. It's as good as any, but nothing mind blowing. ROOM: The room itself was enormous. There were two pie-slice shaped rooms actually with a wall between them. The first room contained a living room with 2 walk-in closests, a couch, armchair, coffee table, end tables, desk, desk chair, tv stand. There was a kitchenette with a small range, sink, microwave, dishwasher and fridge, as well as cooking and eating utensils and a coffee maker. A small dining table and 4 chairs was also provided. A sliding door allowed access to the private balcony. The second room contained a small (but nice) bathroom, linen closet, another walk-in closet, and bedroom. The bedroom contained a king size bed, sitting chair, ottoman, dresser, tv, and two night stands. The bedroom also had access to the balcony. Both rooms were spacious, tastefully decorated, and very clean. SHUTTLE: Didn't inquire. STORE: None on site, but there were some vending machines with basic supplies. There was a Wawa (mini grocery) nearby as well as a Rite-Aid and Walgreen's (Drug Store). SUPPLIES: The bathroom basics soap, shampoo, conditioner, and kitchen supplies such as pots, pans, dishes, glasses and utensils were provided.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: lolo-caro
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 14 nights in this Hotel. Everything was OK (except an early morning fire alert the first night). Room was clean, huge (a least 30m2) comfortable and the Kitchen was useful. Breakfist (managed by Sharon) is OK (do it yourserlf waffle, bagles, yogourt, muffin...) and complementary newspaper was delivered everyday. Ok it's not luxurious and some work need to be done but price + location (5' walk from suburban station for a direct connection to airport using R1 train) is the best solution for phily if you don't want to spend to much money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BZBS
Reviews.Content: Location is terrific. Room spacious, clean and comfortable. Kitchen fully equipped (dish towel and dishwasher detergent appeared after a couple of days) and included microwave popcorn. Staff very pleasant and helpful - and got us out and back in very quickly during fire alarm. It was a false alarm. It wasn't luxurious but met all our needs and exceeded all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, good location”
Reviews.Author: elvismonkee
Reviews.Content: The great thing about the Windsor Suites is its location. Just a 5 minute walk from City Hall and another 5 minutes to Market Street. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, no frills but a good place to stay. Rooms are big, with a walk-in closet and full kitchen amenities. This building however could benefit from a lick of paint, but overall we enjoyed our stay here and would consider staying again

Reviews.Title: “The Windsor Is The Only Hotel I Will Ever Stay In”
Reviews.Author: phillys8189010
Reviews.Content: I LOVED MY STAY AT THE WINDSOR at 1700 Ben Franklin Blvd, center city Philadelphia. I travel all year with work and have stayed in almost all the hotels Center City has to offer. THE ROOMS ARE CLEAN AND HUGE!! The Windsor offers a full kitchen, a huge seperate bedroom with a walkin closet, a kitchen table and computer desk. If that weren't enough, I had free internet access, and a balcony!!! I honestly feel I receieved 5 star accomodations at a 3 star price!! EVERY SINGLE STAFF MEMBER WAS FRIENDLY. Anytime I lost my room, needed extra towels, a taxi, or once I even requested an address and a number for a specific rest., the staff, instead of being annoyed, would smile and say no problem. Everytime, without fail, I was very impressed and to me customer service is extremely important. Understanding that it would be impossible to please everyone all the time, the staff at the Windsor are honesly some of the nicest people I have ever met!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay, Cheap, Old, lack of Security”
Reviews.Author: DanTheTrainingMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Windsor Suites, Philadelphia, PA. and checked in Jan., 2008 an unfortunately I checked out 2 days later (suppose to be a 5 day business trip) because of problems at this hotel. On Tuesday night I returned to my room to find the door to my hotel room ajar (propped open). I immediately told the front desk. They did not check the room but just said â€œSorryâ€�. No offer of compensation was made. I asked to speak to a manager the font desk told me no manager was on duty except her who was a supervisor. She could not do any thing. I would have to talk to James Brown the general manager in the morning. The front desk called me latter that night again said sorry and explained that it was a senior house keeper. They were upgrading the dishware and the housekeeping supervisor is the one who left your door open. It was not done in normal cleaning. I was given the assurance this would not happen again. No compensation offered. It is hotel policy not to put night chain or flip lock on the door. The manager said they do not have them but if I wanted one he would install one. He did have one installed on my door right away. But would not and did not see any need to compensate me for the lack of security in the building and screw up by your staff. In the room it says 100% customer satisfaction guaranteed. One of my other business associates has a dead bolt on his door that does not work. He has no way to properly lock his room. He told the front desk the first night and it is still not fixed after 5 days. My other business friend does not have a lock on his sliding class door. Another business associates had his roof leak because of the old leaky and rusted out pipes in the building. The walls are paper thin. I can hear every word of both my neighborsâ€™ telephone conversations. I have tried to contact the management company that owns the hotel but they too do not see the need to respond. This is the cheapest hotel around and the hotel donâ€™t care what people think because they know because of the price many other people who will fill the vacancies. I always say you get what you pay for. This was not my choice of hotels. I will not stay in Windsor Suites again for any reason. I have moved out to another hotel which is much better. I just looked online for reviews of the hotel and they were not glowing, thatâ€™s for sure. Other people online have had various problems as well with the Windsor Suites as well. Now the management is trying to blame the whole thing on me.

Reviews.Title: “More than decent--but those bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: gutenberg55
Reviews.Content: Like others, I feel that this is a decent or better choice, given the price, excellent location for conventioneers or tourists, free breakfast, friendly staff, and newspaper every day including weekends (wish they all did this). However, two stays in recent years have convinced me that management needs to bite the bullet and renovate the bathrooms and closets. The bathrooms have been patched up and it shows badly. People don't want to see decaying caulk and badly patched tile. Time to get on it!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory at best, better hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: jk2005_yah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the 2nd weekend of Jan for a weekend with my family (2 kids under 5). Had booked here at the last minute since I found out I had a convention to attend to. Booked a suite - which turned out to be a misnomer since there is only 1 single room with a tiny kitchennette stuck on 1 side of the room. The room was spacious since these are former apartments converted into a hotel. The spaciousness was great since both kids loved to play around in the room. The rooms have a slight musty smell (perhaps due to recent painting). The beds were decent and cutlery in the kitchen was a real help. The plumbing is old ( we had to call since we were not getting hot water) and the thermostat for the heating seemed to be from the 1980's. The hotel is very conveniently located and kids had a ball at the nearby "Please Touch" museum. There is a Wava grocery store around the corner, a Subway, Dunkins Donut & TGI's around the hotel (less than 1 block). The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful - not enough to make up for the dinghy hotel hallways. Breakfast was a-ok (equivalent to a Quality Inn breakfast). If you paid as much as I did ($200+) you will find a better quality stay at the nearby Embassy Suites or the Sheraton. Overall, it was a less than decent stay and the size of the room & convenient location do not make up for the less than plesasant experience. Wont be going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we expected”
Reviews.Author: bradfordRyeBrook_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights with family 12/27-29 2007. Hotel in Great location, short walk to many museums, approx 1 mile from Independence Hall/ Visitors ctr. Positive things about our stay: - 1 BR suite with pullout in LR was perfect for our family of 5 (they also brought us up a cot upon request.) - Very reasonable rates - Breakfast included - Location great - Onsite valet parking - Actual room in excellent condition- modernized and clean Negative things: - Hallways were smelly and drab -Only 3 small elevators for fairly substantial hotel- very crowded at peak hours - No ondemand / video game offerings on tv's. Overall, we would go there again, mainly because suites like this are difficult to find in the center of a major metro area like Phila.

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive Experience From Recent Stay at Windsor Suites”
Reviews.Author: JimmyjCalgary
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Windsor Suites in November. I was participating in the Philadelphia Marathon and wanted to stay at a hotel close to the start and finish line. We arrived on Wednesday evening with our rental car. We used the valet parking service which was available and the service was remarkable. It was great because we could exit the parkade any time. As well I was aprehensive about staying at the hotel after reading the many negative reviews but was very positive that the reviews must be incorrect. Our bathroom had recently been remodelled and you could smell "fresh" paint. The room overall was very spacious includuing a walk-in closet which we utilized with our luggage. The breakfast included at the hotel was fine - it was just like being at home. The location was close to everything we needed for the weekend. My recommendation would be for those negative reviewers that perhaps if they should check into the Four Seasons located one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad ... just needs some touch-ups”
Reviews.Author: CleveRocks
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the property is the location. It's not walking distance from the historical area, but it is right in the thick of the area with many of the museums. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was HUGE. And the balcony was a great feature. Great view of the city. The many walk-in closets are about the size of some hotel rooms I've stayed in in the past. The in-room combination safe was a nice touch. So was the sealed bag of microwave popcorn next to the coffee maker (the in-room kitchen has a microwave). People who are very nitpicky and need everything to be exactly perfect should stay away. Our room really needed some small touches such as paint. The place is old and it shows, but people like me see a charm in that. It was exceptionally clean. It was also very quiet even though it was completely sold out. We stayed there because we were competing in the Philadelphia Marathon. All we needed was a comfortable and quiet place to sleep before the race and a hot shower after the race. A+ on both accounts. And they gave us a late checkout simply for the asking, which made the difference between a great hot shower and a rest after the race, and a long tired and sweaty drive home to Atlantic City. Just down the block is a Dunkin Donuts, and around the corner is a Wawa Food Market, a regional chain of convenience stores nown for their deli foods, great coffee, and convenience items. TGI Fridays is a block away, and the city is full of fine dining experiences. I'd be eager to stay there again, no question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Suites was Great!”
Reviews.Author: lamorris99
Reviews.Content: Windsor Suites were pretty awesome. I was really expecting disappointment due to all of the reviews suggesting that this hotel was only good for the location. We had many good experiences at this hotel. We checked in pretty late and our studio room was unavailable, so they checked us into a 1 bedroom for 1 night. The 1 bedroom was ok no problems. The next day we packed up our bags and put them by the door...after being out almost all day we came back and they had moved our bags for us to our new room, the studio. This room was better, it appeared to be recently remodeled with a much more modern bathroom, flat screen TV, and nice city view. Actually the 1 bedroom was huge, and the studio was just the right size for us. Throughout our stay the staff was extremely helpful. Patty was very nice and gave us a good recommendation on the WaWa Market (which is behind the hotel on Arch). WaWa was open late and we were able to get hot sandwiches to take back to our room. Try the Italian sandwich it was awesome. Great walking distance as everyone has said, we loved Eastern State Penn. and the Mutter Museum. Bathroom toiletries were nice and the lotion is a convenient item to take home if you are a woman that is a big lotion user like me. It squeezes out easily and doesn't get too messy. When we checked out we had an 8pm flight and the hotel had no problem holding our baggage in a locked room, it was quite convenient. Everytime we asked them for directions (which was everyday) they were helpful and not bothered. They even printed out some instructions on the subway line and wrote down directions for us to the Eagles game. The only thing I didn't like was the smell of some of our neighbors cooking. You couldn't smell it in your room though, just in the hallway on the way to and from the elevators. I think people live in some of the apartments, so the food smell makes sense. It was just a little annoying. Overall we loved our stay and would return to the Windsor if in Philly again.

Reviews.Title: “Reall enjoyed the Windsor Suites”
Reviews.Author: TODon86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor Suites for an extended weekend and we really enjoyed it. The hotel is close to the musuems and plenty of great resataurants. It's in a very safe area and close to most attractions. The hotel offers parking right at the hotel although it is a parking garage that charges. The lobby and rooms were very clean and quiet and the rooms have small kitchens with everything you would need if you decided you wanted to cook yourself. The showers were great too. The beds were very comfortable as well. All of the staff that we met were very nice and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Almost forgot... the rates were very reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: spd017
Reviews.Content: There are many naysayers who want to trash this hotel because it doesn't have the amenities of a five-star. That said, everyone needs to understand that you are paying for the location, not the amenities. If you are a tourist, (or like myself, someone that lived in the town for years and just wanted to visit home and only having to park the car once,) this place will suit you. It is nothing spectacular, but it combines competance, convienience, location, and decent service. If you're complaining about this hotel, nine times out of ten you have too much money for this place and never should have come here. The Windsor is SOLID. You pay for one hell of a location and valet parking. Add a decent balcony for a city that doesn't have enough hotels with balconies. If you're considering this hotel, you want location and decent service. You will get this. As long as I'm unfortunate enough to live outside of the wonderful city of Philadelphia, I will want to stay in the Windsor. I'll never be rich enough to say that place is a disappointment, but if I was that rich, I'd buy the hotel and make sure it never disappointed anyone again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Deal”
Reviews.Author: AwayWeGo-NJ
Reviews.Content: This was a nice looking boutique hotel and the staff was pleasant. They were very accomodating for an early check-in. . Couple of issues: the pool was pea soup green and although we reported it, we did not see anyone treating it nor did it improve during our stay. The view was nice, but the windows certainly could use a cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: gelukkig_mens
Reviews.Content: I let my husband book this property as he wanted a "say" in where we would stay for our vacation as I had booked all but the Philadelphia hotel; therefore I, being a good wife, let him do so. I do admit that the location was good for the sight seeing we were planning to do, the pool was enough to entertain our 6 year old, and most of the staff (house keeping and two front desk employees) were friendly, but that was it in terms of â€œgood pointsâ€�. FRONT DESK We were a party of 7 (three rooms) and when we checked in I had to ask three times for the rooms to be put on the same floor. In the end, only two of the rooms ended up being on the same floor and one was directly below the other ;ok, I can live with that, but the front desk did not specify which rooms belonged to which party so that when I lost my key, I was nearly given a cavity search and I was read the riot act before I could get a room key. Finally a manager (?) took pity on me and grudgingly gave me a new card. ROOM Only one of the three rooms that we booked was somewhat refurbished (bathroom only). The kitchenette area in all of them looked run down and I would not dare to use any of the utensils that they provided. The refrigerators were clean though. Our room was the worse of the three. The carpet felt sticky, the bathroom looked like something out of a 5th world country and the air-conditioning never got cold even though it was on the highest setting. We were only there for two nights so I did not complain as I did not want to hurt my husbandâ€™s feelings and once he gets dug in he does not like to move- but he did "consent" to let me do all the planning in the future â€“whhooo hooo!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and dirty”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMian
Reviews.Content: We took our two children to Philadelphia on vacation to what I thought was a nice hotel, it was so dirty I could hardly stand it. My 11 month old who likes to eat off the floor had to be held or put into her pack & play to prevent her from touching the grim and curoded dirt around the stove and dishwasher. They put us in a room that had a teriible odor and behind the nightstand was mounds of dirt and dust with old nail clippings, q-tips and lots of nasty things. I felt like I was in a motel in the middle of no where until I left my room where the service actually very good. A manager came to spray the room to cover the odor which only served to flared up my asthma. While waiting for my car in the expensive parking lot, I was told the battery was dead in a vehicle that is only a few months old. Overall I was very dissapointed and would rather pay more to be in a cleaner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: geentyprudhomme
Reviews.Content: I booked at Windsor because of it's central location. I had never been to Philly and was there for just a few days. My primary reason for visiting Philly was to see the King Tut exhibit, the Franklin Institute is just a few blocks away. I also wanted to see as much of the city as possible. I earth googled it and mapquested it so I would see right where I was. It was a perfect location. I am a front office manager in a very upscale hotel and was somewhat disappointed in this place. I checked in and the valet parkers were rude from the get go. I had absolutely no assistance with my luggage. My luggage were small pieces and I would have not accpeted help, but not even an offer of assistance. Once I arrived to my room, I found the room (905) to be much larger than I expected and the view of the parklway perfect! I then discovered that the safe did not work;I had every intention of using it. I also discovered that the bathroom sink would not drain and the wireless did not work. I was now frustrated after having been on the road for almost six hours. I called the front desk and was told someone would be up to look at those issues. I went downstairs to ask for restaurant recommendations they sent me to two that were closed! At the same time I asked for restaurant recommendations I informed them that I still wanted the issues rectified; when I returned, nothing had been done and I had been gone at least two hours. I called back down to inform them of this. Now keep in mind that I am in this business so I was polite...I deal with the public, so I was empathetic, yet wanted my issues resolved. Someone came up promptly and was able to fix only the drain. I called back down and asked for another room. I was prompty offered a room (1513) on the a higher floor witha balcony, hard wired internet and a bathroom that was remodeled, all nice but with not a nice view which I wanted. A light in the bathroom did not work, I had to call for new light bulbs. I am sure at this point the front desk staff must have thought I was a a problem guest. Like other reviewers I did not get housekeeping services. I have NEVER heard of a hotel that does not automatically send housekeeping into a room if there is not a privacy sign hanging. I did not at all expect turndown service, but I did expect routine stayover cleaning. I also did not like that I had to come down to the lobby to let anyone coming to visit me on the elevator; the front desk or porter should have a list of in-house guests and arrivals, announce guests and open the elevator. I undertand that it's a safety issue right in downtown, and it can be easily fixed by having a staff member announce guests and let them on elevators. I slept well, it was quiet at night being that the hotel is in the business district. The next morning I ask for a place to get breakfast since they only offer a continental breakfast, I was sent to this HORRIBLE dive around the corner called Pumpernick's...do not go there. I found the staff to be courteous and helpful...yet badly mis-informed about concierge issues. Admittedly, I would stay here the next time I go to Philly simply because of it's perfect location for me. It was right where I wanted to be. If my hotel company had a property in Philly I would stay there yet my company does not. All-in-all, an ok place to stay if you are not looking for luxury accomodations and appointments. It's all about location, location, location with this place! Peace!

Reviews.Title: “were very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: EeshPhila_Pa
Reviews.Content: was little worried after booking and then reading some reviews. However, water started to leak from the room above us in the bathroom, after only one phone call to the desk, within 10 minutes we were put into another room, which was even better.Everyone was pleasant and helpful to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find and close to downtown attractions”
Reviews.Author: dsrtwar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a visit and found it to be very acceptable. Our room was clean and had all the standard hotel amenities. The location for our purpose was perfect, we parked in the attached garage and walked everywhere we needed to go. There were enough places to eat nearby to give a good a variety of choices for dinner to include a nearby Fridays and a real good Chineese resturant only three or so blocks away, just around the corner was a small grocery to lay in supplies if you want for the kitchen area in each room. The elevators were a little slow at times and the staff was helpful,but not overly friendly. All in all a reasonable place to stay if you aren't expecting the stars, it is excellent in relation to all the attractions, Independnce Mall, Rittenhouse square and museums if you like strolling the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip for our family! Made better by this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: morningjoy
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a one room suite. The Closet space is massive. The kitchen is fully stocked! We ate breakfast in the room. Packed lunches and ate out for dinner. The tub/shower is modern and drains fine. We saw no bugs! The room has been remodeled or redecorated recently because it's completely modern. We used both double beds and slept fine, my husband raved about his nights sleep. He loves their pillows. Our oldest daughter slept on the couch and enjoyed her stay. We loved the pool! It's warm and the view is terrific! My husband used the workout room each night, as well as the pool. The staff bent over backwards for us! Each day we walked to 2nd street and traveled around the historical area, back to the hotel and then off with dad for dinner (dad worked most of the time). We also saw the Franklin Institute, Tut exhibit, and zoo. The children loved the big bus tour, fire house museum, story benches, Ben Franklin's court, liberty bell, Independance hall, Constitution Museum, Visitor's center, Betsy Ross' house, Camden Aquarium. We are looking forward and hoping to visit again. We will stay in the same hotel! FYI, Aron is 6 mo, Shannen is 2 yrs, Amanda is 4 yrs, Paige is 10, I'm 32. Yes, we truely walked all over Philadelphia the five of us and back. (I did use one or two strollers depending on the day.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: sarcasm28
Reviews.Content: I got the best rate on their website which was about $20-$30/night cheaper than hotels.com. It is quiet at night since it is in a primarily business district and the walk to Rittenhouse Square is a little sketchy. We were surprised when our room was not cleaned and the bed was not made after our 1st night, we were told that we have to request this, which I have never experienced before. At any hotel I have been to, both cheap and expensive, turn down service was always standard. The staff was friendly and helpful and called as soon as we got into the room to make sure everything was to our liking. The room was large and the bathrooms were recently updated with nice fixtures (still with the tags). The hotel is about 4-5 blocks to Rittenhouse Square and about 3 blocks from the City Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Are you serious?”
Reviews.Author: ANM208
Reviews.Content: The place seemed just fine. It was a bit of a walk from some of the places we went to in the City, but after the first night walking back to the hotel, we realized the streets were friendlier from a cab. What threw me though at this place was that at no time when that dreamy, scruffy looking concierge was checking my party in did he suggest we ASK for housekeeping services. Yes folks, I'm serious, it's not an automatic given at this place. I was speechless when at 3 PM I returned to my room to find the bed and the bathroom in the same state of disrepair that I left it in that morning when I left at 8 AM. Apparently, according to the concierge on duty at the time I called down, I hadn't requested housekeeping. There was no extra charge apparently for it and of course my room wasn't any cheaper for not having it... but since I hadn't requested it at the time of my check-in the day before, I hadn't gotten it. To be fair though, the fella did offer to send someone up to take care of it then, but I figured at that point since I was leaving in the morning, I'd save the $5 bucks I would have tipped the cleaning lady and slept in my unmade bed that night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and good location.”
Reviews.Author: AllyssaDFW
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to Rittenhouse Square and the trolley line. Room was nice and large, and staff was efficient. Be careful when asking for recommendations on where to eat. We were sent to a "moderate restaurant" which cost an average of $25/plate. It was tasty, but more upscale than what we were looking for. The bed wasn't very comfortable, but being pregnant might have biased me. I would say your average hotel, with the only downside being that there were some really drunk college kids in the elevator, but we couldn't hear them while in our room.

Reviews.Title: “sad but true . . .”
Reviews.Author: neolite
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews of this hotel before we went, and it is sad that so many of them were true. It is a great location for the museums, the suites are big and quiet, and it is nice to have a kitchen to save $$, but this hotel is in really poor shape. Perhaps some of the rooms are already renovated and thus others' experiences reflect that? All I know is that our room had on only one sleepable bed out of three (two doubles and a sofa bed), it was musty, paint slapped on, mildewy shower curtain, some of the furniture rickety--basically pretty battered in every way. I will say that we stayed anyway and did enjoy the convenience of the location. Like most people, we didn't want to hassle switching hotels/rooms either. Besides the room condition, the service was so-so. When we valet parked, no one seemed ready to help us with our bags coming in or leaving. We saved money by not tipping, but if you needed help with bags, you'd have trouble getting any. We also had a bit of a bug problem (ants) in the kitchen. After we requested the kitchen garbage removed (they didn't take it when they cleaned after the first night), the bugs abated. We also kept all the food in the fridge after that. All in all, the room and hotel are uniformly beat up and most people won't find it acceptable. If they were to renovate this hotel, we'd go back because we did like the big room and view, but otherwise it is really in poor shape and there are many other better places to stay, some of them cheaper (we discovered), depending on the dates.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKit
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Windsor in Philadelphia. We had two very comfortable beds, an efficiency kitchen, and a balcony overlooking downtown area in the museum district. Staff were very friendly upon check in/out and helpful when needing local information. Be sure to meet Lee at the Mace's pub next door, and experience the WaWa convenience stores that seem to be everywhere. Walking 6 blocks, we used the Chinatown to Chinatown commuter bus ($20RT) to go to NYC two days in a row and felt we were successful in seeing the best of both cities over a short stay. The Hotel Windsor proved to be the best decision I made when shopping on line for a comfortable hotel in Philadelphia.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: lildoc81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Windsor at the end of November as I was interviewing at Hahnemann Hospital. I was in need of a relatively affordable hotel near the hospital (I'm a student and on a very limited budget). When I checked in, the staff was as courteous and gracious as could be, and upgraded me from a single room to a suite. The suite turned out to be an old apartment unit, complete with living room and full kitchen, not to mention a walk-in closet. I was only staying for one night, but I did appreciate the gesture. The room itself was old and dark, but fully functional for my purposes. There are two restaurants attached to the hotel, but they looked a little sketchy, so I walked to the TGI Friday's down the street and ate there instead. Upon returning from dinner, I overheard two maintenance men discussing how they were being summoned to the 10th floor because of mice. That definitely didn't sit well with me, and given the rundown nature of the hotel, I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bargin Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Stewart
Reviews.Content: The reviews are mixed, so discarding those who never made it there to actually stay, the rest seem to me about the expectations they carry with them. My travel companion and I searched long and hard for our accommodation in Philly. This was bar far the best bet - the highest quality, good location, and great amenities, for the cheapest price. Large rooms, old but solid classic wooden hotel furniture. The rooms are huge, have basic but working full kitchen, safe, tv, internet etc and are well heated. Being able to open the windows, or in some rooms, enjoy a balcony, means no cooking smells last long in your room;) No extra frills in terms of pools, etc, but the downstairs restaurants are great. You are also close to other food, wine, supermarket and internet locations: a must in the freezing Philly weather. The front desk were helpful, if curt. The main complaints I have are: 1. They are currently renovating all their plumbing for the showers etc - obviously old and slow draining... so some rooms you end up standing in half a foot of water while showering, but they're on their way to fixing most of this as I write. 2. I was missing a remote control and the phone didn't work when I arrived. I mentioned these, went out for the day, and found the a control on my return and the phone working. the odd and amusing thing was the regular smell of grass in the hallway at around 7pm - someone obviously finished work and sat bakc to relax each night. For reference I ended up paying only $110 AUD per night for five nights. I would recommend booking directly if at all possible, or using internet sites to get the cheaper rate but then calling a day latter to confirm with the hotel to ensure they have a room reserved for you - expedia failed in this regard and I got lucky on the day with their vacancy rates (the hotel front desk indicated this happens regularly, and isn't their fault). All round, excellent value if you don't NEED 5+ star, but do need all the basics to be warm, clean, safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude!”
Reviews.Author: MGinCT
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay here. I checked the price on-line but then decided to call the hotel to book to ensure that I could get a non-smoking room; we're traveling with our 2-month old. After a series of "can you holds?," I talked to a very disinterested reservations clerk (named after a popular Frito-Lay corn chip product, only with an -a not an -o ending, perhaps to emphasize her femininity). Anyway, the price she quoted me was higher than the Expedia price, which I though was odd, especially given that Expedia is taking out something before the hotel gets its take. I asked her about the price difference, but she just gave me the silent treatment punctuated with the occassional loud tapping of fake nails on a desk to express her lack of patience. Finally, she replied that the higher number is their price, and that's it. I'm not sure if she just lacked the discretion to match the Expedia price, but her attitude toward service certainly prejudiced me against staying here. Anyway, the upside is that I have now belatedly done my research on the hotel, and my quick experience over the phone seems to mirror the opinions of the tripadvisor community. Life is too short to tolerate bad attitudes! I'll gladly spend $50 more for a better experience elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here under any circumstances”
Reviews.Author: nazzbazz
Reviews.Content: I can't say that we actually stayed at the Windsor. After about 10 minutes in the room, we left and checked into the nearby Marriott. Even though it meant losing the $178 it cost me for the first of two nights that we had planned to stay here. Most of the reviews online indicated that it was a less expensive hotel and so we were prepared to sacrifice some of the usual amenities. However, the room was ill-lit--the bedroom being too dark, the bathroom and kitchen lit up as bright as a gas station off the turnpike. The bathroom was small and creepy. It looked as though it hadn't been re-modeled in 40 years. It was clean, but that's about all you can say for it. For $50 more a night you can stay at the Marriott or similar hotel in Center City. If you can afford the extra $50, then by all means spend it on a better hotel. By all means, avoid the Windsor unless you are traveling on a VERY tight budget. And even then, find a Holiday Inn Express or similar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Carol757
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this is a not a luxury hotel. It is, however, very good for the price. Our room was large, with a well-equipped kitchen. Our only complaint with the room was that the lighting was not good, so it was difficult to read in bed. The location is fabulous, close to many museums.

Reviews.Title: “Middling experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bibliogirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a cheap place to stay in Philadelphia for two days so we booked a room here. The room was extremely large, though poorly lit and slightly strange smelling (perhaps because of the kitchen). Our biggest problem was the heater, which had no thermostat, so we were constantly flipping in on and off. There is also no high-speed internet, despite their claims to the contrary. The location, however, was fantastic. It is right near several lovely squares and shopping districts, not to mention the many museums that line Ben Franklin Parkway. This is definitely not a luxury hotel (by any stretch of the imagination) but it is a very basic, excellently-located hotel for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “October 12-15, 2006 Stay”
Reviews.Author: NoBodySpecial
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a stay at the Hotel Windsor for October 12-15, 2006. We arrived at the hotel and received our room cards promptly. One has to swipe the room card at the elevator to access them and get up to your floor and again at the door of the room. We were assigned to room 1203. We also noticed that some people reside at this hotel. The room was very large. It had a kitchen with dishwasher, stove, oven, a full-size refrigerator and sink, along with plenty of dishes and silverware. They also have an ice machine down the hall, along with washing machines. Yes, the hotel is old, but that shouldnâ€™t make a difference if everything is well maintained. Expect the smell of all kinds of food that people are cooking in their rooms to permeate all areas. You did ask for a room with a kitchen. The bathroom sink was stopped up when we arrived. The next day when I ask to have it unstopped, they did try, but I think they need to clean the pipes. There werenâ€™t many channels available on the TV, but we didnâ€™t come for that. Friday morning, the temperature went down to 40 or so. I tried to turn on the heat, but it didnâ€™t work. I asked at the front desk and they said the heat would not be turned on for another week! I guess you get what you pay for. We knew this was a cheaper hotel than most in the area. They are doing some expensive renovations to balconies right now and it looks like this will last for some time so be forewarned. Also, they are building a very large office building right across the street, so if you are a light sleeper and donâ€™t want to hear loud construction starting at 7AM, you may want to steer clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this inept, uncaring hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmandl
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a room for a business trip that fell through. When we called to cancel, we were told the hotel had the discretion to issue a refund if the hotel could rebook the room. I was told by the reservation department that the hotel had sold out, yet the general manager refused to issue a refund. He said his "hourly clerks" in the reservation department typically give out misinformation. The GM repeatedly said things like, "why should i deal with you?" and belittled the significance of the amount of money we had lost - not a business expense since the business had fallen through. He said he certainly had the power to issue the refund but would not. It seems the management at Hotel Windsor is inept and uncaring about its guests or generating return business and certainly has no confidence in its own staff. This reflects poorly on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Windsor Hotel Ok; parking terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Windsor hotel was ok, but have stayed at better hotels in the area for less money. Parking attendents at the hotel are not very friendly. We called the front desk to ask if they would call the garage for out car and they said they do not offer this service. It took 20 minutes to get our car from the garage and we had to go from the parking garage back to the front desk back to the garage in order to get a special in/out pass. The hotel was clean, but the two restaraunts in the hotel do not offer breakfast and its very challnging to find a place to eat on a Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The four of us traveled to tour the USS New Jersey on which my brother-in-law had served. We stayed three nights at this hotel. WE LOVED IT!!!The room was clean, quiet and very spacious. The closet space was unreal. We were on the sixth floor and really enjoyed sitting on the balcony. We moved the dining room chairs back and forth to the balcony. I suggest there be chairs or lounges on the balcony. The staff WERE SO FRIENDLY, HELPFUL, AND WONDERFUL. They gave us directions for our journey to Camden and told us if we could not find our way back to the hotel, they would send someone for us. You do not ge this kind of service anywhere else. We were also told if we needed medical attention for my brother-in-law, they would call for someone to help him. The over all service could not have been any better. It is without hesitation that I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. ALSO TO THE FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL PEOPLE OF PHILLY AND CAMDEN THANK YOU for our memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sweetdaisy233
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Windsor this week for two nights, along with my mother (in a separate room). A few things.... 1) The first rooms we were given had doors and windows that didn't lock (on a ground floor where people could climb in), and smelled terribly like curry. (I love curry, but this was a sickening smell). 2) The second set of rooms we were given had bathtubs that wouldn't drain (I couldn't even take a shower without the water overflowing the entire bathtub), rooms that smelled terrible, cracks in the walls, half painted walls, tons of noise on the outside....and to top it all off, someone came in my room while I was gone and used the restroom without flushing the toilet! (I know this because I didn't use the bathroom that morning, and when I came back to my room, it was full of urine). Overall, a terrible stay. The people are unfriendly, unsupportive - the place is run down and needs some major investment. Great location, horrible hotel. Stay away and check in next door at the Embassy Suites. (Same price, much better hotel)

HotelInfo.Name: The Windsor Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy, Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
